gurmukhi: ਗਣ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬ ਜੱਛ ਸਭੈ ੳੁਰਗੰ ॥ ਬਰਦਾਨ ਦਯੋ ਸਿਵ ਕੋ ਦੁਰਗੰ ॥
transliteration: Gad Gaddhrab Jachchh Sabhai Udgadg|| Bardaan Dayo Siv Ko Dudgadg||
translation: Shiva marched forward alongwith Ganas, Gandharavas, Yakshas and Nagas and Durga also granted boon to him.

gurmukhi: ਹਨਿਹੋ ਨਿਰਖੰਤ ਮੁਰਾਰ ਸੁਰੰ ॥ ਤ੍ਰਿਪੁਰਾਰ ਹਨਯੋ ਜਿਮ ਕੈ ਤ੍ਰਿਪੁਰੰ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Haniho Nirkhanndmurar Suran|| Tripuraar Hanyo Jim Kai Tripuran||14||
translation: The gods began to see that Shiva would kill Andhakasura in the same way as he had killed the demon Tripura.14.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਹੁ ਓਰ ਚੜੇ ਦਲ ਲੈ ਦੁਜਨੰ ॥ ੲਿਹ ਓਰ ਰਿਸਯੋ ਗਹਿ ਸੂਲ ਸਿਵੰ ॥
transliteration: Uh(u) Or Chade Dal Lai Dujanan|| Ih Or Risyo Gad(i) Sool Sivan||
translation: Form the other side that demons of vicious intellect started. From this side in great fury and holding the trident in his hand, Shiva moved.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਰੰਗ ਰੰਗੇ ਰਣ ਧੀਰ ਰਣੰ ॥ ਜਨ ਸੋਭਤ ਪਾਵਕ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ ਬਣੰ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Ran Ran Rane Ran Dheer Ranan|| Jan Sobhat Paavak Jvaal Banan||15||
translation: Intoxicated with war-tactics, the mighty warriors presented the scene like the blazing flames of fire in the forst.15.

gurmukhi: ਦਨੁ ਦੇਵ ਦੋੳੂ ਰਣ ਰੰਗ ਰਚੇ ॥ ਗਹਿ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਸਭੈ ਰਸ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਮਚੇ ॥
transliteration: Dan(u) Dev Dooo Fan Ran Rache|| Gad(i) Sastra Sabhai Ras Rudra Mache||
translation: Both the demons and gods became absorbed in the war and bedecking themselves with weapons all the warriors enjoyed the relish of anger.

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਛਾਡਤ ਬੀਰ ਦੋੳੂ ਹਰਖੇ ॥ ਜਨੁ ਅੰਤ ਪ੍ਰਲੈ ਘਨ ਸੇ ਬਰਖੇ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Sar Chhaadat Beer Dooo Harkhe|| Jan(i) Ant Pralai Ghan Se Barkhe||16||
translation: The warriors of both the sides enjoyed the shooting of arrows and the arrows are being showered like the raining of clouds on the doomsday.16.

gurmukhi: ਘਾੲਿ ਖਾੲਿ ਭਜੇ ਸੁਰਾਰਦਨ ਕੋਪੁ ਓਪ ਮਿਟਾੲਿ ॥ ਅੰਧਿ ਕੰਧਿ ਫਿਰਯੋ ਤਬੈ ਜਯ ਦੁੰਦਭੀਨ ਬਜਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Ghaae Khaae Bhajaa Suraardan Kop(u) Op Mitaae|| Andh(i) Kandh(i) Phiryo Tabai Jay Doundbbeen Bajaae||
translation: The demons being wounded and becoming weak began to run away and at that time, Andhakasura, resounding his drums turned and moved towards the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਲ ਸੈਹਥ ਪਰਘ ਪਟਸਿ ਬਾਣ ਓਘ ਪ੍ਹਾਰ ॥ ਪੇਲ ਪੇਲ ਗਿਰੇ ਸੁ ਬੀਰਨ ਕੇਲ ਜਾਨ ਧਮਾਰ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Sool Saihath Paragh Patas(i) Baan Ogh Prahaar|| Pel Pel Gire Su Bderan Kel Jaan Dhamaar||17||
translation: The blows were struck with tridents, swords, arrows and other weapons and arms and the warriors swung and fell; it seemed that there was a programme of dance and amorous pastime.17.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਲ ਰੇਲ ਭੲੀ ਤਹਾ ਅਰ ਤੇਗ ਤੀਰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰ ॥ ਗਾਹਿ ਗਾਹਿ ਫਿਰੇ ਫਵੱਜਨ ਬਾਹਿ ਬਾਹਿ ਹਥਿਯਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Sel Rel Bhaitahaa Ar Teg Teer Prahaar|| Gadh(i) Gadh(i) Phire Phavajjan Baah(i) Baah(i) Hathiyaar||
translation: With the blows of swords and arrows, there was consternation in the battlefield and striking their weapons, the warriors were stirring up the armies.
